Astro3d¶

Astro3d provides a GUI and engine to create a 3D model from an astronomical image. The 3D model is saved in a STL file, which can then be sent to a 3D printer.

Installation¶

Requirements¶

Astro3d requires:

  • Python 2.6 (>=2.6.5), 2.7, 3.3, or 3.4
  • Numpy 1.6 or later
  • Scipy
  • matplotlib
  • Astropy 1.0 or later
  • Pillow or PIL
  • PyQt4
  • photutils
  • qimage2ndarray

Obtaining the Source Package¶

The latest development version of astro3d can be cloned from github using this command:

git clone git://github.com/STScI-SSB/astro3d.git

Installing from the Source Package¶

To install from the root of the source package:

python setup.py install

Installing using pip¶

To install the current development version using pip:

pip install git+https://github.com/STScI-SSB/astro3d

Using astro3d¶

  • Reference/API
    • astro3d.model3d
    • astro3d.meshes
    • astro3d.textures
    • astro3d.image_utils
